questions.question: What is the primary purpose of Support Vector Machines (SVM) in machine learning?

options.A: To classify data by finding the optimal hyperplane.
options.B: To store data in a hierarchical structure.

questions.explanation: SVMs classify data by finding the optimal hyperplane that separates different classes.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common kernel used in SVM?
questions.explanation: Linear Kernel is a common kernel used in SVM to classify linearly separable data.

questions.question: What is the role of the kernel trick in SVM?

options.A: To transform data into higher dimensions.

questions.explanation: The kernel trick transforms data into higher dimensions, allowing SVM to classify non-linearly separable data.

questions.question: Which method is used to prevent overfitting in SVM?
questions.explanation: Regularization prevents overfitting in SVM by controlling the complexity of the model.

questions.question: What is the significance of the margin in SVM?
questions.explanation: The margin determines the optimal hyperplane, maximizing the distance between different classes in SVM.

questions.question: Which of the following is a disadvantage of SVM?
questions.explanation: SVMs are complex to interpret, especially when using non-linear kernels.

questions.question: What is the purpose of using soft margin in SVM?

options.A: To allow misclassification of some data points.
options.D: To store data in a hierarchical structure.

questions.explanation: Soft margin allows misclassification of some data points, providing flexibility in SVM classification.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common use case for SVM?
questions.explanation: SVMs are commonly used for classification tasks, where data is categorized based on the optimal hyperplane.

questions.question: What is the role of support vectors in SVM?
questions.explanation: Support vectors define the optimal hyperplane, influencing the classification decision in SVM.

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of SVM?
questions.explanation: SVMs are effective in high-dimensional spaces, providing accurate classification in complex datasets.

questions.question: What is the significance of the C parameter in SVM?

options.A: It controls the trade-off between margin size and misclassification.
options.D: It stores data in a hierarchical structure.

questions.explanation: The C parameter controls the trade-off between margin size and misclassification, influencing the flexibility of SVM.

questions.explanation: Polynomial Kernel is a common kernel used in SVM to classify non-linearly separable data.
